message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Net Impact IIT Kharagpur's photo. With the number of days left for examination inversely proportional to the peace of mind. Net Impact IIT Kharagpur in association with Your DOST brings to you a Workshop-cum-Interactive session on " Managing Exam Stress - Emotional Wellness and Managing life " Mr. Aditya Sisodia will guide you on how to overcome the stress of exams and how to make best out of it. Venue : Gargi Auditorium | Date : 11th Feb 2017 | Time : 2 PM Registration link : http://bit.ly/yourdostworkshop

We have started accepting CVs for the events of 5th Inter IIT Tech Meet.

The criteria for CV shortlisting will be based on:
1. Relevant skills
2. Past Experience in Relevant field
3. Achievements in Relevant field
Make sure you prepare your CV accordingly. The CV should not be more than 1 page. 

The CVs along with all the proving certificates/documents are to be mailed to interiittechmeet.kgp@gmail.com with the Subject "*Event Name* - CV Shortlisting". Any e-mails with any other subject won't be considered. All the files and scanned copies should be strictly in pdf format. 

Deadline for submission: 22/02/17 8 pm

**Note: There will be a different selection criteria for Messier Marathon. It will be revealed later.

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS's photo.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS's photo. *TFPS Screenings* We are pleased to announce that for the first time (since our inception), we will be organizing an official screening of the recent feature-length film, Shreelancer, directed by Sandeep Mohan, the founder of the concept of 'The Great Indian Travelling Cinema'. It is also the first time that Shreelancer is being screened at an IIT. 6.30 PM | 8th Feb | Maitrayee Auditorium | Runtime 97 minutes It will be followed by a short interaction with the director himself. Hope you show us some love.

Moments of joy and sounds of "Kata Re" make you lively again. For any details of Festival you may contact Vijay :- 7548906156

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur is organizing the screening of "Challenge of Change", a documentary film on the life and teachings of Jiddu Krishnamurti will be screened followed by Question and Answer session with Mr. P. Chhabra and Prof. P. Krishna, at Gargi Auditorium from 6.30pm on 11th January, 2017!

This will be followed up by a lecture by Dr Krishna on 12th January at Gargi Auditorium on "Science and Spirituality".

Jiddu Krishnamurti is regarded globally as one of the greatest thinkers and religious teachers of all time. story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo. In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts are being made to protect the inventions by the students and researchers. We would like to identify and protect the technologies to be displayed in the upcoming Techno-management festival Kshitij™. In this regard all the institute participants of Kshitij events especially (i) Eureka, (ii) Embetronics, (iii) Droid Blitz, (iv) Conquest, (v) Arm Of Achelous, (vi) Sandrover, (vii) B.R.I.C.K.S, (viii) Kryotech, (ix) Anadigix and (x) Initiative Prakriti are requested to send an abstract along with required drawings of their invention to submissions@ktj.in. "The deadline for the institute participants has been exclusively extended up to the 12th of Jan " The patentable inventions will be recommended for filing after scrutiny by the expert techno-legal committee. Please be assured that Institute will provide all necessary support to protect your valuable inventions. Please note that all your valuable inventions need to be protected by filing the patent before disclosing to the public. This is an excellent opportunity to protect and look for the possible marketability and commercial viability of your inventions. Such protection prevents the unauthorized use of your invention and provides a meaningful exclusionary right to the patent holder. The details of Kshitij events can be found in the following link: http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events

“Problem solving leaders have one thing in common: A faith that there’s always a better way”
Are you apt enough to look for opportunities within the problems? Prefer prevention more than intervention?

Pre-Case released!
The wait is over! Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur presents the first round of the Indian Case Challenge 2017, India’s biggest case study competition. 
Gear up yourselves as teams from the best colleges in India compete to prove their business entrepreneurial mettle. Confronted with a real life case scenario, just strong business skills and financial know-how won’t be enough. Only those with a spark of creativity and a zeal for realizing business opportunities will make it through.
We look forward to ingenious strategies and innovative ideas. Wishing best of luck to the participating teams! 
The case will be sent to the registered teams via email. Last date of submission for the preliminary round is 10th January 2017.
If you have not registered yet, head over to http://bclub.co.in/icc2017/register/

Tomorrow, the Rekhi Centre of Excellence for the Science of Happiness and Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur would like to welcome Mr Ramesh Kulkarni, for the screening of a short film titled "The purpose of life. Connecting the dots..." and a short Q&A session afterwards, which would aim at boosting the mental and spiritual depth of the students here. Mr Ramesh Kulkarni is an author and the initiator of the center for introspection & enlightenment, Vancouver, Canada.

All students are invited to be a part of this session at the Language Lab iii, JCB Lab Complex (Vikramshila) on 5th Dec (tomorrow) 3pm onwards.

In order to increase the participation of IIT Kharagpur in various open-source programs like Google Summer of Code, Outreachy and much more, a new initiative by Kharagpur Open Source Society has been taken for the students of IIT Kharagpur to help them prepare for many prestigious open source programs.

Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) is a December-long online program where the students will get a unique experience of software development while being coached by mentors all around the open source world as well as many ex-GSoCers.

Go to http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in and register yourself. The program starts on 1st December. The program is open to all students regardless of their department, course, degree or the year.

Also, if you want to be a mentor in the program, go to the website and host your project.

Kindly register your opinion at Prime Ministers portal about rendering education in regional and national languages at higher education seats like IITs,AIIMS etc so that common people can understand engineering and medical science in India. Europe has different languages but every country there gives higher education to its citizens in their respective languages,then why India suffers from the backlash of English medium.Even China renders education in Chinese are those people backwards? Scorpene data leak could have been avoided had our websites been built in Hindi. Just think about it! I've registered my opinion at PMs portal, register this thought now and help India be a developed country faster! #PMO

On the occasion of birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel (First Home Minister of Independent India), Rashtriya Ekta Saptah is being celebrated across the country. To commemorate this, Technology Students’ Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur is organizing ‘RUN FOR UNITY’ on 05th November 2016 (Saturday) at 5:45 a.m.  The race will commence from TSG and after covering a distance of approximately five km, will end at TSG.  You are cordially invited to take part in ‘RUN FOR UNITY’.

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Robotix Society's post.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Robotix Society's post. Here is a chance for 1st year and 2nd year students to attend the Winter Workshop for Robotics and kick start with all the tech stuff in KGP. Winter workshop is your entry point for getting into any research group (like AGV, KRSSG, ARK, AUV and swarm) and also in the inter hall tech GC team. We will teach you about autonomous robotics and Image Processing. Please fill out this form to show your interest in attending the workshop. The workshop is conducted in the month of December after end semester exams in two phases. Phase 1: 1-7th December Phase 2: 10-16th December. There is going to be a test soon and attendance in that test is compulsory for winter workshop. Fill out the form here http://bit.ly/wws-2016 . We have compiled a list of frequently asked questions and made a FAQ here https://www.robotix.in/winter-workshop/faq . If your queries are still not cleared, feel free to ping us on this facebook page. Hope to you see you all in the workshop.

message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post. "All of us are one, bathing in the joy of the spirit that makes everyone in KGP that little bit different from others because no one else has what we call the 'Illu Experience'.” -Professor P.P. Chakrabarti ‘Illumination’ a culture unique to IIT Kharagpur has been upholding the fundamental and true spirit of Diwali since four decades. It has caught a lot of attention nationwide since it is environment friendly. Thinkers and tinkerers here is a glimpse of the magnificent event 'Illumination'. We extend our heartfelt thanks to the hall representatives and TSG for cooperating with us and helping us in making it possible. Credits: पुरु बंसल Shashwat Pandey Mrutyunjaya Mohapatra Prashant Jeph Shubhangi Bhushan Chandra Mohan Meena Chirag Bariya Shubham Uttam Hardik Jain Video Credits : Pankaj Kamble

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared The Street's photo.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared The Street's photo. ATTENTION Finance enthusiasts ! The Street- Finance Club is organizing a Panel Discussion of the Students who have been experienced with the interning experiences in esteemed Finance Corporations.As you might be soon going for one, or preparing to go for one later, this might be an opportunity for all of you to have your doubts cleared or any other Knows - What are the technicalities underlying these Internship things ,etc. So, Welcome you all for the Panel Discussion and we hope to see you all with us !! VENUE - Raman Auditorium DATE - 21st October, FRIDAY TIME - 6 PM

A short (1 credit) course is being introduced by Rekhi Centre of Excellence for the Science of Happiness between the last week of October and 1st week of November 2016.

The short course, Introduction to the Science of Happiness (Lectures 10 + interactions & tests 5 hrs), can be credited/audited by both UG and PG students (including PhD scholars). Since we are expecting a large intake and the seats are restricted, we request interested participants to pre-register. Details are given at:

http://www.happiness-iitkgp.org/happiness/pre_registration_details.php

Resource person: Prof. M. K. Mandal, Director General - Life Sciences, DRDO
Coordinators: Prof. P. Patnaik and Prof. D. Suar, HSS

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo. Congratulations to Team Aerial Robotics of IIT Kharagpur for their prize-winning performance in the "International Aerial Robotics Competition", Asia-Pacific Venue during 23-24th September, 2016 in Beijing China. They were awarded "Best Team Cooperation Award" for their efforts out of total 9 teams from China and India (only our team from India). The team members are: Soumyadeep Mukherjee, Aditya Agarwal, Gaurav Gardi, Kumar Ankit, Kumar Krishna Agarwal, Manash Pratim Das, Sai Ram, Vishnu Sharma It is a research group sponsored by the Institute through SRIC as part of Centre for Excellence in Robotics. The principal Investigator for the project is Prof. Somesh Kumar (MA) and it is mentored by Prof. Jayanta Mukhopadhyay (CSE) and Prof. D.K. Pratihar (ME).

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur's photo. Carrying on this novel approach of rediscovering ancient Indian history, the Institute in association with Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur has organized a lecture under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) titled 'Astronomical Dating and Re-evaluating Ancient Indian Chronology' by Professor Amitabha Ghosh. Date: October 3, 2016 (Monday) || Time: 5:30 P.M. Venue: Kalidas Auditorium Prof. Amitabha Ghosh is Former Director and Distinguished Professor, IIT Kharagpur, Platinum Jubilee Senior Scientist of The National Academy of Sciences India. You are cordially invited to be part of this rediscovery of ancient Indian heritage through scientific means. Let us trace back our roots which would strengthen our identity as Indians and global citizens.

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared M N Faruqui Innovations Centre's photo.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared M N Faruqui Innovations Centre's photo. Fresher's Introductory Seminar Date : 29th September | Thursday Time : 6:00 PM Venue : F-116 | Bhatnagar Auditorium M N Faruqui Innovations Centre is one of its kind platform, which provides you an opportunity to tinker, design and innovate. You can get full funding and complete support to implement your ideas. In the Introductory seminar, you'll get to know how you can propose your idea, get in touch with professors and involve with MNFIC to implement it. Be there. At time. Design Credits: Prerit Gupta​

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Metakgp's post. Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester exams went well. As the library site was down for most part of mid-semester exams, our site MFQP was also rendered to be down for the first few days, but we found a way out so that we could keep serving papers to everyone in KGP! Now, let's all contribute, and increase the papers MFQP has. Our Paper Collection Drive starts today! We request everyone to submit their mid-semester question papers. Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send. 1. Take a picture of your question paper 2. Write Subject Code in email 3. Send to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com And, do visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work towards achieving that goal. That's all folks! Have a nice week ahead!

प्रिय विद्यार्थियो, संस्थान के समस्त आदरणीय कार्मिकगण,
हिंदी दिवस 2016 आयोजन की श्रृंखला में संस्थान में अनेक कार्यक्रम आयोजित किए जा रहे हैं। इसी क्रम में दिनांक 26 सितम्बर 2016 को शाम 1500 बजे से एक कार्यक्रम- “मातृभाषा काव्य पाठ प्रतियोगिता, काव्य संध्या, एवं साहित्यिक गीतों की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति” का किया जा रहा है। इस कार्यक्रम में संस्थान छात्रों, कार्मिकों एवं उनके परिवारीजनों सहित उनके मित्रगणों का भी स्वागत है।
इस प्रतियोगिता में आप अपनी मातृभाषा में एक कविता स्वयं की लिखी हुई अथवा किसी प्रतिष्ठित कवि की रचना प्रस्तुत कर सकते हैं। न्यायमंडल के रुप में कोलकाता से सुप्रतिष्ठित कवि ऋषि श्री योगेन्द्र शुक्ल, काव्य मर्मज्ञ प्रो. प्रेम शंकर त्रिपाठी, सुप्रसिद्ध गजलकार श्री नंद लाल रोशन तथा टाटानगर से अतिसम्मानित गीतकार प्रो. शेष नाथ सिंह एवं श्री शैलेष जी को आमंत्रित किया गया है। प्रतिभागियों के काव्य पाठ के पश्चात न्यायमंडल के सदस्य युवा प्रतिभागियों के लिए सुझाव एवं परामर्श देंगे तथा अपनी चुनींदा रचनाओं का पाठ करेंगे।
हमारे साहित्यिक गीत हमारी सांस्कृतिक धरोहर हैं। श्री ओम प्रकाश मिश्र जी अखिल भारतीय स्तर पर साहित्यिक गीतों की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति के लिए जाने जाते हैं। एक अनूठा आयोजन एवं अद्भुत अनुभव रहता है श्री मिश्र जी को सुनना और हर आंख भर आती है जब वे माँ, पिता, भाई, बहन, बिटिया, पुत्र, परिवार, समाज, बदरिया, किसान आदि पर बच्चन, नागार्जुन, दिनकर, यश मालवीय, ओम व्यास, आचार्य विष्णुकांत शास्त्री आदि परम पूज्य साहित्यकारों की रचनाओं की संगीतमय प्रस्तुति करते हैं।
आपसे निवेदन है कि काव्यपाठ प्रतियोगिता हेतु अपनी एक सर्वश्रेष्ठ कविता, गीत तैयार कर सहभागिता करें। rajbhasha@hijli.iitkpg.ernet.in अथवा hindiofficeriitkharagpur@gmail.com पर अपना पंजीकरण अनिवार्यतः कराएं। विजेताओं को आकर्षक पुरस्कार हिंदी दिवस समापन समारोह में किसी अन्य दिन दिए जाएंगे।
कृपया इस संदेश को अधिक से अधिक साथियों, मित्रों, परिवारों, समूहों तक पहुंचाएं।
निवेदक
अध्यक्ष
राजभाषा विभाग
भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर
81718, 81864, 9641049944 9564156315
